useM6.title: Use M6
useM6.description: Disable to avoid outputting M6. If disabled Preload is also disabled

preloadTool.title: Preload tool
preloadTool.description: Preloads the next tool at a tool change (if any).

showSequenceNumbers.description: Use sequence numbers for each block of outputted code.

sequenceNumberStart.title: Start sequence number
sequenceNumberStart.description: The number at which to start the sequence numbers.

sequenceNumberIncrement.title: Sequence number increment
sequenceNumberIncrement.description: The amount by which the sequence number is incremented by in each block.

optionalStop.title: Optional stop
optionalStop.description: Outputs optional stop code during when necessary in the code.

separateWordsWithSpace.title: Separate words with space
separateWordsWithSpace.description: Adds spaces between words if 'yes' is selected.

useRadius.title: Radius arcs
useRadius.description: If yes is selected, arcs are outputted using radius values rather than IJK.

dwellInSeconds.title: Dwell in seconds
dwellInSeconds.description: Specifies the unit for dwelling, set to 'Yes' for seconds and 'No' for milliseconds.

setupAtCenterOfCAxis.title: Setup at center of C axis
setupAtCenterOfCAxis.description: Specifies if the machine is zeroed at the center of C-axis rotation.

safeRetractDistance.title: Safe retract distance
safeRetractDistance.description: A set distance to add to the tool length for rewind C-axis tool retract.

useRigidTapping.title: Use rigid tapping
useRigidTapping.description: Select 'Yes' to enable, 'No' to disable, or 'Without spindle direction' to enable rigid tapping without outputting the spindle direction block.

longDescription: Generic ABB Rapid post. Please refer to the User Guide for programming specification and sample. Always validate with Robot Studio before loading any toolpath on your Robot.

flipToolFrame.title: Flip tool frame
flipToolFrame.description: Flip the tool frame (Z- is along the tool axis).

firstPointType.title: First point move type
firstPointType.description: Set if the first point is defined by joint angles (joints values are needed but arm configuration can be ignored) or using cartesian coordinates (robot arm configuration data are required but joints value can be ignored).

useSubfolder.title: Use subfolder
useSubfolder.description: Specifies if files should be saved in subfolder or not.

useCoolants.title: Use coolants
useCoolants.description: Specifies if Robot needs Coolant Codes

nameLimitation.title: Toolpath name max 30 chars
nameLimitation.description: Check if each toolpath name has max 30 characters.

robotStartJ1.title: Robot joint 1
robotStartJ1.description: ABB robot joint value used for the initial position point before MoveL start.

robotStartJ2.title: Robot joint 2
robotStartJ2.description: ABB robot joint value used for the initial position point before MoveL start.

robotStartJ3.title: Robot joint 3
robotStartJ3.description: ABB robot joint value used for the initial position point before MoveL start.

robotStartJ4.title: Robot joint 4
robotStartJ4.description: ABB robot joint value used for the initial position point before MoveL start.

robotStartJ5.title: Robot joint 5
robotStartJ5.description: ABB robot joint value used for the initial position point before MoveL start.

robotStartJ6.title: Robot joint 6
robotStartJ6.description: ABB robot joint value used for the initial position point before MoveL start.

robotToolData.title: Robot tool name (prefix)
robotToolData.description: ABB robot tool name prefix to use.

robotWorkObjectData.title: Robot workobject data name (prefix)
robotWorkObjectData.description: ABB robot work object data prefix to use.

robotHeadAngle.title: Head angle
robotHeadAngle.description: ABB robot head angle around tool axis. X axis is 0 deg.

writeDateAndTime.title: Write date and time
writeDateAndTime.description: Output date and time in the header of the code.

endEffectorBehavior.title: End-effector state
endEffectorBehavior.description: Set the end-effector state (including behavior during flat toolpath transitions).

fffToolData.title: Robot tool data
fffToolData.description: ABB tool data used for FFF toolpath

fffBaseData.title: Robot base data
fffBaseData.description: ABB Work Object Coordinates System (WOCS) used for FFF toolpath

weldingSeamdata.title: Welding seamdata
weldingSeamdata.description: Describes how the seam is to be started and ended (refer to ABB manual for more details).

weldingWelddata.title: Welding welddata
weldingWelddata.description: Describes the actual welding phase (refer to ABB manual for more details).

weldingWeavedata.title: Welding weavedata
weldingWeavedata.description: Describes how any weaving is to be carried out (refer to ABB manual for more details).

weldingWaitTime.title: Welding wait time
weldingWaitTime.description: Instruction to wait a given amount of time in seconds.

_trigger.title: Trigger
_trigger.description: Specifies whether to use the Z-height or layer number as the trigger to change temperature of the active Extruder.

_triggerValue.title: Trigger Value
_triggerValue.description: This number specifies either the Z-height or the layer number increment on when a change should be triggered.

tempStart.title: Start Temperature
tempStart.description: Specifies the starting temperature for the active Extruder (degrees C). Note that the temperature specified in the print settings will be overridden by this value.

tempInterval.title: Temperature Interval
tempInterval.description: Every step, increase the temperature of the active Extruder by this amount (degrees C).

temperatureTower.title: Temperature Tower
temperatureTower.description: Temperature Towers are used to test new filaments in order to identify the best printing temperature. When utilized, this functionality generates a Gcode file where the temperature increases by a set amount, every step in height or layer number.

rotaryTableAxis.description: Select rotary table axis. Check the table direction on the machine and use the (Reversed) selection if the table is moving in the opposite direction.

useInverseTime.description: 'Yes' enables inverse time feedrates, 'No' outputs DPM feedrates.

useActiveSpindle.title: Use active spindle
useActiveSpindle.description: Enable to use spindle commands (S, M3, M4, ...).

useRadius.title: Radius arcs

_trigger.title: Trigger
_trigger.description: Specifies whether to use the Z-height or layer number as the trigger to change temperature of the active Extruder.

_triggerValue.title: Trigger Value
_triggerValue.description: This number specifies either the Z-height or the layer number increment on when a change should be triggered.

tempStart.title: Start Temperature
tempStart.description: Specifies the starting temperature for the active Extruder (degrees C). Note that the temperature specified in the print settings will be overridden by this value.

tempInterval.title: Temperature Interval
tempInterval.description: Every step, increase the temperature of the active Extruder by this amount (degrees C).

temperatureTower.title: Temperature Tower
temperatureTower.description: Temperature Towers are used to test new filaments in order to identify the best printing temperature. When utilized, this functionality generates a Gcode file where the temperature increases by a set amount, every step in height or layer number.

longDescription: This post interfaces to CAMplete TruePath build 677 or later. The post creates the required project files with the tool information and model and stock for automatic import into CAMplete TruePath. If no fixture is selected, the part will get placed in the center of the table. If a fixture is selected without a fixture coordinate system, the part will get placed relative to the global part origin. If a fixture and a fixture coordinate system is selected, the part will get placed relative to the fixture coordinate system.

onlyXYArcs.description: Only allow arc output on the XY plane.

includeOffsets.title: Include offsets
includeOffsets.description: Specifies whether or not to include the offsets section in the project.

exportFixture.title: Export fixture
exportFixture.description: Specifies whether or not to export the fixture STL with the project.

exportPart.title: Export part
exportPart.description: Specifies whether or not to export the part STL with the project.

exportStock.title: Export stock
exportStock.description: Specifies whether or not to export the stock model with the project.

longDescription: Post for exporting toolpath to the Creality CR10, CR20, and Ender range of printers in gcode (CR10, CR10 V2..., CR20 ..., Ender 3, 5...). As some firmware doesn't support inch gcode, we force millimeter generation by default. For allowing inch output change the 'Allow g-code output in Inches' property

enableBedLeveling.title: Enable bed leveling
enableBedLeveling.description: Specifies if the bed leveling is activated via M420.

allowInchesOutput.title: Allow g-code output in inches
allowInchesOutput.description: Specifies if the firmware support printing gcode generated in inches (G20).

_trigger.title: Trigger
_trigger.description: Specifies whether to use the Z-height or layer number as the trigger to change temperature of the active Extruder.

_triggerValue.title: Trigger Value
_triggerValue.description: This number specifies either the Z-height or the layer number increment on when a change should be triggered.

tempStart.title: Start Temperature
tempStart.description: Specifies the starting temperature for the active Extruder (degrees C). Note that the temperature specified in the print settings will be overridden by this value.

tempInterval.title: Temperature Interval
tempInterval.description: Every step, increase the temperature of the active Extruder by this amount (degrees C).

temperatureTower.title: Temperature Tower
temperatureTower.description: Temperature Towers are used to test new filaments in order to identify the best printing temperature. When utilized, this functionality generates a Gcode file where the temperature increases by a set amount, every step in height or layer number.

longDescription: Generic milling post for Creative Evolution.

longDescription: Use this post to understand which information is available when developing a new post. The post will output the primary information for each entry function being called.

showParameters.description: If enabled, all Parameter values will be displayed

showTool.title: Show Tool values
showTool.description: If enabled, all Tool values will be displayed

showState.title: Show state
showState.description: Shows the commonly interesting current state.

expandCycles.title: Expand cycles
expandCycles.description: If enabled, unhandled cycles are expanded.

showTCP.title: Show TCP values
showTCP.description: If enabled, XYZ positions are shown in the Setup system.  Disable to show the coordinates in the Working Plane system

longDescription: This post outputs the toolpath in the DXF (AutoCAD) file format. Note that the direction of the toolpath will only be preserved if you enabled the 'forceSameDirection' property which will trigger linearization of clockwise arcs. You can turn on 'onlyCutting' to get rid of the linking motion. And you can turn off 'includeDrill' to avoid points at the drilling positions. You can specify a specific layer by setting the property called 'layer'. If you enable the property 'putOperationsInSeparateLayers' each operation will be put into separate layers incremented by 1.

useTimeStamp.title: Time stamp
useTimeStamp.description: Specifies whether to output a time stamp.

onlyCutting.title: Only cutting
onlyCutting.description: If enabled only cutting passes will be output, all linking moves will be ignored.

includeDrill.title: Include drill
includeDrill.description: If enabled circles will be output for all drill positions.

forceSameDirection.title: Force same direction
forceSameDirection.description: Enable to keep the direction of the toolpath, clockwise arcs will be linearized.

longDescription: Generic post for Epilog Laser. The post will output an HTML page with embedded SVG graphics which can then be printed using the installed Epilog Laser printer. You can do both through-cutting and etching in the same program by enabling the 'useColorMapping' property. When enabled, RED (255,0,0) will be used for through-cutting and GREEN (0,255,0) for etching. You have to make sure to turn on color mapping and adjust the power settings correspondingly in the Epilog settings. By default you will get BLUE (0,0,255) for both through-cutting and etching. Enable the 'useWCS' property to force the part placement to match the WCS setting in the Setup. Otherwise the workpiece will be centered according to the given 'width' and 'height' properties. Also keep in mind that you can choose the alignment of the workpiece in the print dialog (e.g. Top-Left corner).

useTimeStamp.title: Use time stamp
useTimeStamp.description: If enabled, a time stamp is outputted.

width.title: Width(mm)
width.description: Width in mm, used when useWCS is disabled.

height.title: Height(mm)
height.description: Height in mm, used when useWCS is disabled.

embedInHTML.title: Embedded in HTML
embedInHTML.description: Enable to output SVG embedded in HTML.

longDescription:
Generic post for ESAB Vision CNC plasma cutting. Incremental or Absolute output. 
Position torch at X0Y0 when starting program. Torch will return to X0Y0 at end of program.
Specify plasma cutting parameters filename in post properties

longDescription: Generic post for use with all common 3-axis HAAS mills like the DM, VF, Office Mill, and Mini Mill series. This post is for the pre-Next Generation Control. By default positioning moves will be output as high feed G1s instead of G0s. You can turn on the property 'useG0' to force G0s but be careful as the CNC will follow a dogleg path rather than a direct path.

useG0.description: Specifies that G0s should be used for rapid moves.  Make sure that Setting 335 (LINEAR RAPID MOVE) is set to 'Linear + Rotary'.

useG28.title: Use G28 instead of G53
useG28.description: Specifies that machine retracts should be done using G28 instead of G53.

useSubroutines.title: Use subroutines
useSubroutines.description: Select your desired subroutine option. 'All Operations' creates subroutines per each operation.

useG187.title: Use G187
useG187.description: Specifies that smoothing using G187 should be used.

optionallyCycleToolsAtStart.title: Optionally cycle tools at start
optionallyCycleToolsAtStart.description: Cycle through each tool used at the beginning of the program when block delete is turned off.

optionallyMeasureToolsAtStart.title: Optionally measure tools at start

toolBreakageTolerance.title: Tool breakage tolerance

safeStartAllOperations.title: Safe start all operations

useG95forTapping.title: Use G95 for tapping
useG95forTapping.description: use IPR/MPR instead of IPM/MPM for tapping

safeRetractDistance.title: Safe retract distance for rewinds
safeRetractDistance.description: Specifies the distance to add to retract distance when rewinding rotary axes.

safeRetractDistanceZ.title: Safe Z-retract distance for head rotations
safeRetractDistanceZ.description: Specifies the distance above the part to retract to when positioning rotary axes on a head machine.

useDWO.title: Use FCS
useDWO.description: Specifies that the Feature Coordinate System (G268/G269)  should be used.

preferredDirection.title: Preferred B-axis direction
preferredDirection.description: Select the desired direction for the B-axis.

g53HomePositionX.title: G53 home position X
g53HomePositionX.description: G53 X-axis home position used as safe tool change position.

g53HomePositionY.title: G53 home position Y
g53HomePositionY.description: G53 Y-axis home position used as safe tool change position.

forceHomeOnIndexing.title: Move to home prior to head alignment
forceHomeOnIndexing.description: Enable to move to the defined G53 home position in X & Y prior to a head alignment move.

adjustKnuckleAngle.title: Automatic C-axis positioning
adjustKnuckleAngle.description:
Choose the automatic positioning of C-axis based on the direction of a 3-axis cut.
Disabled - disables automatic positioning, 
Preposition - prepositions the C-axis prior to each move, 
Stay down - repositions the C-axis prior to the move when the limit is reached, 
Retract - retracts and repositions the C-axis when the limit is reached, 
Lock - locks the C-axis at the current angle when the limit is reached,

knuckleCircular.title: Circular C-axis positioning
knuckleCircular.description:
Choose the output style for automatic positioning of the C-axis on circular blocks.
Yes - outputs the C-axis on a circular block, 
No - linearizes circular moves when Automatic C-axis positioning is enabled, 
Lock - locks the C-axis at the current angle for circular blocks,

baseKnuckleAngle.title: Base C-axis positioning angle
baseKnuckleAngle.description: Defines the direction of the C-axis for a move along the postive X-axis in degrees.

singleResultsFile.title: Create single results file
singleResultsFile.description: Set to false if you want to store the measurement results for each probe / inspection toolpath in a separate file

longDescription:
Generic post for the HAAS Next Generation control. The post includes support for multi-axis indexing and simultaneous machining. The post utilizes the dynamic work offset feature so you can place your work piece as desired without having to repost your NC programs.
You can specify following pre-configured machines by using the property 'Machine model':
UMC-500
UMC-750
UMC-1000
UMC-1600-H

hasAAxis.title: Has A-axis rotary
hasAAxis.description: Enable if the machine has an A-axis table/trunnion. Check the table direction on the machine and use the (Reversed) selection if the table is moving in the opposite direction.

hasBAxis.title: Has B-axis rotary
hasBAxis.description: Enable if the machine has a B-axis table/trunnion. Check the table direction on the machine and use the (Reversed) selection if the table is moving in the opposite direction.

hasCAxis.title: Has C-axis rotary
hasCAxis.description: Enable if the machine has a C-axis table. Specifies a trunnion setup if an A-axis or B-axis is defined. Check the table direction on the machine and use the (Reversed) selection if the table is moving in the opposite direction.

useDPMFeeds.title: Rotary moves use DPM feeds
useDPMFeeds.description: Enable to output DPM feeds, disable for Inverse Time feeds with rotary axes moves.

useTCPC.description: The control supports Tool Center Point Control programming.

useDWO.description: Specifies that the Dynamic Work Offset feature (G254/G255) should be used.

longDescription:
Generic post for the HAAS Next Generation control. The post includes support for multi-axis indexing and simultaneous machining. The post utilizes the dynamic work offset feature so you can place your work piece as desired without having to repost your NC programs. This post will output pictures for use with the M130 feature.
You can specify following pre-configured machines by using the property 'Machine model':
UMC-500
UMC-750
UMC-1000

longDescription: Preconfigured HAAS ST-10 post with support for mill-turn. You can force G112 mode for a specific operation by using Manual NC Action with keyword 'usepolarmode'.

writeMachine.title: Write machine
writeMachine.description: Output the machine settings in the header of the code.

writeTools.title: Write tool list
writeTools.description: Output a tool list in the header of the code.

writeVersion.title: Write version
writeVersion.description: Write the version number in the header of the code.

showSequenceNumbers.title: Use sequence numbers
showSequenceNumbers.description: Use sequence numbers for each block of outputted code.

sequenceNumberStart.title: Start sequence number
sequenceNumberStart.description: The number at which to start the sequence numbers.

sequenceNumberIncrement.title: Sequence number increment
sequenceNumberIncrement.description: The amount by which the sequence number is incremented by in each block.

optionalStop.title: Optional stop
optionalStop.description: Outputs optional stop code during when necessary in the code.

separateWordsWithSpace.title: Separate words with space
separateWordsWithSpace.description: Adds spaces between words if 'yes' is selected.

useRadius.title: Radius arcs
useRadius.description: If yes is selected, arcs are outputted using radius values rather than IJK.

maximumSpindleSpeed.title: Max spindle speed
maximumSpindleSpeed.description: Defines the maximum spindle speed allowed on the main spindle.

subMaximumSpindleSpeed.title: Max spindle speed for subspindle
subMaximumSpindleSpeed.description: Defines the maximum spindle speed allowed on the subspindle.

useParametricFeed.title: Parametric feed
useParametricFeed.description: Specifies the feed value that should be output using a Q value.

showNotes.title: Show notes
showNotes.description: Writes operation notes as comments in the outputted code.

useCycles.title: Use cycles
useCycles.description: Specifies if canned drilling cycles should be used.

autoEject.title: Auto eject
autoEject.description: Specifies whether the part should automatically eject at the end of a program.

g53HomePositionSubZ.title: G53 home position subspindle Z
g53HomePositionSubZ.description: G53 Z-axis home position when Secondary Spindle is active.

g53WorkPositionSub.title: G53 subspindle working position
g53WorkPositionSub.description: G53 working position for Secondary Spindle when active.

useTailStock.title: Use tail stock
useTailStock.description: Enable to use the tail stock.

useBarFeeder.title: Use bar feeder
useBarFeeder.description: Enable to use the bar feeder.

gotChipConveyor.title: Got chip conveyor
gotChipConveyor.description: Specifies whether to use a chip conveyor.

usePolarCircular.title: Use polar circular
usePolarCircular.description: Enables circular interpolation with polar output.

xAxisMinimum.title: X-axis minimum limit
xAxisMinimum.description: Defines the lower limit of X-axis travel as a radius value.

setting102.title: Feed rate calculation diameter
setting102.description: Defines the part diameter in inches that the control uses to calculate feed rates.

rapidRewinds.title: Use G0 for rewinds
rapidRewinds.description: Uses G0 moves for rewinding of the C-axis.

useSSV.title: Use SSV
useSSV.description: Outputs M38/M39 to enable SSV for turning operations.

optimizeCAxisSelect.title: Optimize C-axis selection
optimizeCAxisSelect.description: Optimizes the output of enable/disable C-axis codes.

gotSecondarySpindle.title: Got secondary spindle
gotSecondarySpindle.description: Specifies if the machine has a secondary spindle.

numberOfRepeats.title: Number of repeats
numberOfRepeats.description: How many times to loop the program.

useSimpleThread.title: Use simple threading cycle
useSimpleThread.description: Enable to output G92 simple threading cycle, disable to output G76 standard threading cycle.

airCleanChuck.title: Air clean chucks
airCleanChuck.description: Enable to use the air blast to clean out the chuck on part transfers and part ejection.

safeStartAllOperations.title: Safe start all operations
safeStartAllOperations.description: Write optional blocks at the beginning of all operations that include all commands to start program.

useYAxisForDrilling.title: Position in Y for axial drilling
useYAxisForDrilling.description: Positions in Y for axial drilling options when it can instead of using the C-axis.

useG187.title: Use G187
useG187.description: Specifies that smoothing using G187 should be used for milling operations.

longDescription: Generic post for use with 3-axis HAAS mill with a trunnion mounted on the table along the X-axis. This post is for the pre-Next Generation Control. By default positioning moves will be output as high feed G1s instead of G0s. You can turn on the property 'useG0' to force G0s but be careful as the CNC will follow a dogleg path rather than a direct path.

longDescription: Generic HAAS turning post. Turn on the property 'manualToolChange' if your CNC does not have an automatic tool changer. Use Turret 0 for Positional Turret, Turret 101 for QCTP on X- Post, Turret 102 for QCTP on X+ Post, Turret 103 for Gang Tooling on X- Post, Turret 104 for Gang Tooling on X+ Tool Post.

longDescription: Generic post for the HAAS UMC-750. The post includes support for multi-axis indexing and simultaneous machining. The post utilizes the dynamic work offset feature so you can place your work piece as desired without having to repost your NC programs. By default positioning moves will be output as high feed G1s instead of G0s. You can turn on the property 'useG0' to force G0s but be careful as the CNC will follow a dogleg path rather than a direct path. This post is for the pre-Next Generation Control.

forceHomeOnIndexing.title: Move to home prior to head alignment
forceHomeOnIndexing.description: Enable to move to the defined G53 home position in X & Y prior to a head alignment move.

adjustKnuckleAngle.title: Automatic C-axis positioning
adjustKnuckleAngle.description:
Choose the automatic positioning of C-axis based on the direction of a 3-axis cut.
Disabled - disables automatic positioning, 
Preposition - prepositions the C-axis prior to each move, 
Stay down - repositions the C-axis prior to the move when the limit is reached, 
Retract - retracts and repositions the C-axis when the limit is reached, 
Lock - locks the C-axis at the current angle when the limit is reached,

knuckleCircular.title: Circular C-axis positioning
knuckleCircular.description:
Choose the output style for automatic positioning of the C-axis on circular blocks.
Yes - outputs the C-axis on a circular block, 
No - linearizes circular moves when Automatic C-axis positioning is enabled, 
Lock - locks the C-axis at the current angle for circular blocks,

baseKnuckleAngle.title: Base C-axis positioning angle
baseKnuckleAngle.description: Defines the direction of the C-axis for a move along the postive X-axis in degrees.

singleResultsFile.title: Create single results file
singleResultsFile.description: Set to false if you want to store the measurement results for each probe / inspection toolpath in a separate file

longDescription: Generic post for 4-axis HAAS mill. This post is for the pre-Next Generation Control. By default positioning moves will be output as high feed G1s instead of G0s. You can turn on the property 'useG0' to force G0s but be careful as the CNC will follow a dogleg path rather than a direct path.

longDescription: Generic post for the Handibot. Since Handibot doesn't have a tool changer you can only post when all operations use the same tool. By default the post operates in 3-axis mode. If you use the 5-axis manual table you need to enable the property 'fiveAxis'. The NC program will wait for the operator to manually index the table using a PAUSE whenever the orientation changes.

fiveAxis.title: Five axis
fiveAxis.description: Defines whether the machine is a 5-axis router.

gaugeLength.title: Gauge length (IN)
gaugeLength.description: Always set in inches. Change this for your particular machine and if recalibration is required. Use calibration macro to get value.

longDescription: Generic post for HURCO. Note that this post supports both ISNC (ISO NC mode) and BNC (Basic NC mode). By default ISNC mode is used but you can switch to BNC mode by disabling the 'isnc' property. Also note that you can turn on 3D arcs by enabling the 'allow3DArcs' property so you will get arcs in any plane instead of only in the primary planes G17/G18/G19. Note that the HURCO CNC cannot guarantee that no gouging will happen at rewinds when using vector output for multi-axis simultaneous machining as vector does not provide enough information. You need to define the machine in the post to be safe.

_triggerValue.description: This number specifies either the Z-height or the layer number increment on when a change should be triggered.

tempStart.title: Start Temperature
tempStart.description: Specifies the starting temperature for the active Extruder (degrees C). Note that the temperature specified in the print settings will be overridden by this value.

tempInterval.title: Temperature Interval
tempInterval.description: Every step, increase the temperature of the active Extruder by this amount (degrees C).

temperatureTower.title: Temperature Tower
temperatureTower.description: Temperature Towers are used to test new filaments in order to identify the best printing temperature. When utilized, this functionality generates a Gcode file where the temperature increases by a set amount, every step in height or layer number.

useG54x4.title: Use G54.4
useG54x4.description: Fanuc 30i supports G54.4 for workpiece error compensation.

useSubroutines.title: Use subroutines
useSubroutines.description: Select your desired subroutine option. 'All Operations' creates subroutines per each operation, 'Cycles' creates subroutines for cycle operations on same holes, and 'Patterns' creates subroutines for patterned operations.

useFilesForSubprograms.title: Use files for subroutines
useFilesForSubprograms.description: If enabled, subroutines will be saved as individual files.

safePositionMethod.title: Safe Retracts
safePositionMethod.description: Select your desired retract option. 'Clearance Height' retracts to the operation clearance height.

useRigidTapping.title: Use rigid tapping
useRigidTapping.description: Select 'Yes' to enable, 'No' to disable, or 'Without spindle direction' to enable rigid tapping without outputting the spindle direction block.

singleResultsFile.title: Create single results file
singleResultsFile.description: Set to false if you want to store the measurement results for each probe / inspection toolpath in a separate file

longDescription: Generic post for Pocket NC. Note that the XYZ axes of the WCS in the Setup should be set such that the axes all align with the machine XYZ axes in the A0/B0 machine orientation (this means that the WCS Z-axis would be horizontal like on a lathe). By default the post will make the tool go to the home position between operations if the A-axis changes by more than the limit specified by the 'maximumAAxisChange' property (20 degrees by default). You can turn off homing between operations if desired by turning off the 'goHomeBetweenOperations' property but you would have to make sure the tool doesn't collide with the part during AB reorientation.

tempStart.title: Start Temperature
tempStart.description: Specifies the starting temperature for the active Extruder (degrees C). Note that the temperature specified in the print settings will be overridden by this value.

tempInterval.title: Temperature Interval
tempInterval.description: Every step, increase the temperature of the active Extruder by this amount (degrees C).

temperatureTower.title: Temperature Tower
temperatureTower.description: Temperature Towers are used to test new filaments in order to identify the best printing temperature. When utilized, this functionality generates a Gcode file where the temperature increases by a set amount, every step in height or layer number.

longDescription: Generic post for the Shopbot OpenSBP format with support for both manual and automatic tool changes. By default the post operates in 3-axis mode. For a 5-axis tool set the 'fiveAxis' property to Yes. 5-axis users must set the 'gaugeLength' property in inches before cutting which can be calculated through the tool's calibration macro. For a 4-axis tool set the 'fourAxis' property to YES. For 4-axis mode, the B-axis will turn around the X-axis by default. For the Y-axis configurations set the 'bAxisTurnsAroundX' property to NO. Users running older versions of SB3 - V3.5 or earlier should set the 'SB3v36' property to NO.

fiveAxis.title: Five axis
fiveAxis.description: Defines whether the machine is a 5-axis model.

fourAxis.title: Four axis
fourAxis.description: Defines whether the machine is a 4-axis model.

bAxisTurnsAroundX.title: B axis rotates around X
bAxisTurnsAroundX.description: Choose between B-axis along X or Y. This is only applicable when the machine is a 4-axis model.

SB3v36.title: SB3 V3.6 or greater

longDescription: This post outputs the toolpath in the DXF (AutoCAD) file format for use with Universal Laser Systems products. You need the DXF import feature enabled in the Universal Laser software. Note that the direction of the toolpath will only be preserved as long as you keep the 'forceSameDirection' property enabled which will trigger linearization of clockwise arcs. You can turn on 'onlyCutting' to only include the actual cutting passes the output. By default the property 'excludeRetracts' is enabled and will leave out retracts from the output. You can enable the property 'writeCuttingModes' property to output the cutting mode color assignments.

onlyCutting.title: Only cutting
onlyCutting.description: If enabled, only cutting passes will be outputted, all linking moves will be ignored.

excludeRetracts.title: Exclude Retracts
excludeRetracts.description: If enabled, all retract moves will be ignored.

forceSameDirection.title: Force same direction
forceSameDirection.description: Enable to keep the direction of the toolpath, clockwise arcs will be linearized.

writeCuttingModes.title: Write cutting modes
writeCuttingModes.description: Enable to document the colors used for the laser cutting modes

zHomePosition.title: Z home position
zHomePosition.description: Z home position between multi-axis operations.

useSmoothing.title: Use smoothing
useSmoothing.description: Enables BSPLINE style smoothing for contours and multi-axis operations.

smoothingPathDev.title: Path deviation
smoothingPathDev.description: Allowed linear path deviation for smoothing.

smoothingTrackDev.title: Angular deviation
smoothingTrackDev.description: Allowed rotary angle deviation for smoothing.

useRadius.title: Radius arcs
useRadius.description: If yes is selected, arcs are output using radius values rather than IJK in ISO mode.

useMultiAxisFeatures.title: Use ISO work planes
useMultiAxisFeatures.description: Enable to output work planes for 3+2 operations in ISO mode.  Disable to output 3+2 operations using TCP in ISO mode.

abcToler.title: A-axis tolerance
abcToler.description: The tolerance used to determine the output of the A-axis.

longDescription: Milling post for X-Carve by Inventables (Grbl). G28 is turned off by default but can be enabled using the property called 'Safe retracts'.

writeMachine.description: Output the machine settings in the header of the code.

writeTools.title: Write tool list
writeTools.description: Output a tool list in the header of the code.

safePositionMethod.title: Safe Retracts
safePositionMethod.description: Select your desired retract option. 'Clearance Height' retracts to the operation clearance height.

showSequenceNumbers.title: Use sequence numbers
showSequenceNumbers.description: Use sequence numbers for each block of outputted code.

sequenceNumberStart.title: Start sequence number
sequenceNumberStart.description: The number at which to start the sequence numbers.

sequenceNumberIncrement.title: Sequence number increment
sequenceNumberIncrement.description: The amount by which the sequence number is incremented by in each block.

separateWordsWithSpace.title: Separate words with space
separateWordsWithSpace.description: Adds spaces between words if 'yes' is selected.

longDescription: Example post illustrating how to convert the toolpath into XML.

useTimeStamp.title: Time stamp
useTimeStamp.description: Specifies whether to output a time stamp.

highAccuracy.title: High accuracy
highAccuracy.description: Specifies short (no) or long (yes) numeric format.

longDescription: Simple post to export toolpath in CSV format as 2D coordinates.
Simple post to export toolpath in CSV format as 3D coordinates.
XYZ UMC-5X post with Siemens 840D Controller. Note that the post will use D1 always for the tool length compensation.

optionalStop.title: Optional stop
optionalStop.description: Outputs optional stop code during when necessary in the code.

useShortestDirection.title: Use shortest direction
useShortestDirection.description: Specifies that the shortest angular direction should be used.

useParametricFeed.title: Parametric feed
useParametricFeed.description: Specifies the feed value that should be output using a Q value.

showNotes.title: Show notes
showNotes.description: Writes operation notes as comments in the outputted code.

useCIP.title: Use CIP
useCIP.description: Enable to use the CIP command.

toolAsName.title: Tool as name
toolAsName.description: If enabled, the tool will be called with the tool description rather than the tool number.

useSubroutines.title: Use subroutines
useSubroutines.description: Select your desired subroutine option. 'All Operations' creates subroutines per each operation, 'Cycles' creates subroutines for cycle operations on same holes, and 'Patterns' creates subroutines for patterned operations.

useFilesForSubprograms.title: Use files for subroutines
useFilesForSubprograms.description: If enabled, subroutines will be saved as individual files.

cycle800Mode.title: CYCLE800 mode
cycle800Mode.description: Specifies the mode to use for CYCLE800.

cycle800SwivelDataRecord.title: CYCLE800 Swivel Data Record
cycle800SwivelDataRecord.description: Specifies the label to use for the Swivel Data Record for CYCLE800.

useExtendedCycles.title: Extended cycles
useExtendedCycles.description: Specifies whether the extended cycles should be used.

singleLineProbing.title: Single line probing
singleLineProbing.description: If enabled, probing will be output in a single cycle call line.

safePositionMethod.title: Safe Retracts
safePositionMethod.description: Select your desired retract option. 'Clearance Height' retracts to the operation clearance height.

homeXYAtEnd.title: Home XY at end
homeXYAtEnd.description: Specifies that the machine moves to the home position in XY at the end of the program.

longDescription: Post for exporting toolpath to XYZprinting fff range of printers in gcode format (daVinci, nano, mini, junior, color)

_trigger.title: Trigger
_trigger.description: Specifies whether to use the Z-height or layer number as the trigger to change temperature of the active Extruder.

_triggerValue.title: Trigger Value
_triggerValue.description: This number specifies either the Z-height or the layer number increment on when a change should be triggered.

tempStart.title: Start Temperature
tempStart.description: Specifies the starting temperature for the active Extruder (degrees C). Note that the temperature specified in the print settings will be overridden by this value.

tempInterval.title: Temperature Interval
tempInterval.description: Every step, increase the temperature of the active Extruder by this amount (degrees C).

temperatureTower.title: Temperature Tower
temperatureTower.description: Temperature Towers are used to test new filaments in order to identify the best printing temperature. When utilized, this functionality generates a Gcode file where the temperature increases by a set amount, every step in height or layer number.

longDescription: Generic Yaskawa-Motoman post. Please refer to the User Guide for programming specification and sample. Always validate with virtual controller before loading any toolpath on your Robot.

endEffectorBehavior.title: End-effector state
endEffectorBehavior.description: Set the end-effector state (including behavior during flat toolpath transitions).

robotHeadAngle.title: Robot head angle
robotHeadAngle.description: Robot head angle around tool axis

flipToolFrame.title: Flip tool frame
flipToolFrame.description: Flip the tool frame (Z- is along the tool axis).

robotFrameData.title: Robot Frame
robotFrameData.description: WCS number (FRAME) used for FFF toolpath

robotToolData.title: Robot Tool
robotToolData.description: Tool number (TOOL) used for FFF toolpath

nameLimitation.title: Toolpath name max 30 chars
nameLimitation.description: Check if each toolpath name has max 30 characters.

useCoolants.title: Use coolants
useCoolants.description: Specifies if Robot needs Coolant Codes

useSubfolder.title: Use subfolder
useSubfolder.description: Specifies if files should be saved in subfolder or not.

writeDateAndTime.title: Write date and time
writeDateAndTime.description: Output date and time in the header of the code.
